Description: Body sherd of Attic pottery Droop cup; interior glazed black; exterior: from upper wall downward: part of lotus and bud band; broad black band between quadruple lines; frieze of animals in silhouette style (one hen, to right confronting a cock with only back and tail feathers missing); quadruple lines; red band; glazed area near foot.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 4657 (Agora XXIII, pl. 112, no. 1747: Droop cup, dated 550-540 BC); Munich 7415 (CVA Munich 10, pl. 38, no. 1; Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 106, no. 12.33).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.38)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 427-8, no. B680)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 13)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 270-1, no. 59)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0599) (Phase 1)
